title: How a good night's sleep makes a world of difference for your mental health
summary: Five distinct sleep patterns are tied to your health, lifestyle, cognition and even how different regions of your brain connect to one another.
story: Just as a single night of insomnia may leave you feeling groggy and cranky, solid slumber can help you feel rested and ready to take on the day. How well you sleep over time, however, can influence deeper aspects of your health and well-being, new research shows.

Five distinct sleep patterns are tied to your health, lifestyle and cognition and even how different regions of your brain connect to one another, according to a study published Tuesday in the journal PLOS Biology.

Specifically, those “sleep-biopsychosocial profiles” encompass biological, psychological and socioenvironmental factors — such as having a safe, comfortable place to sleep — that contribute to your sleep hygiene.

Much of sleep medicine research focuses on specific problems, such as sleep apnea’s link to cognitive decline, how insomnia affects the heart or whether someone is a night owl or an early bird. The new study, led by researchers at Concordia University in Montreal, looked at the bigger picture.

“People should treat their sleep seriously,” said study co-author Valeria Kebets, manager of machine learning projects at Concordia’s Applied AI Institute. “It affects everything in their daily functioning.”

To define the profiles, researchers analyzed the sleep data of 770 “healthy” young adults ages 22 to 36, indicating they had not been diagnosed with a psychiatric condition, such as bipolar disorder, Kebets said. The data came from the Human Connectome Project, an existing database that studies brain connectivity.
Using a questionnaire called the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index, participants self-reported their sleep characteristics for the previous month.
They also underwent functional MRI, a type of scan that maps brain activity.

“It’s important to look at all these different aspects of sleep, all the different dimensions of sleep, because they’re related to different outcomes and they can also be improved by different interventions,” Kebets said.
Next, Kebets and her team analyzed 118 biopsychosocial measures, such as cognition, substance use, demographics and personality.
Someone may fall into more than one of the five categories Kebets and her team identified, especially over time, she said.
For example, if you’re going through a stressful few months at work, the associated sleep disruptions may temporarily align you with a different profile.
“These are profiles that we all show to a certain degree,” Kebets said.
The researchers identified two general and three specific sleep profiles.
No. 1: Poor sleep and mental health
Characteristics include decreased sleep satisfaction, longer time to fall asleep and greater complaints of sleep disturbances.

People with this pattern of poor sleep experienced daytime impairment and negative emotions, including fear, stress and anger. In addition, people in this group showed worse mental health, such as depression, anxiety and internalizing behavior.
Previous research has shown the association between sleep and mental health.

“Bad sleep begets poor mental health,” said J. Todd Arnedt, director of the Behavioral Sleep Medicine Program and co-director of the Sleep and Circadian Research Laboratory at the University of Michigan Medical School, who wasn’t involved in the study. “Poor mental health begets bad sleep.”
No. 2: Sleep resilience and mental health

People in the second profile also reported negative emotions, including sadness, and poor mental health, namely attention difficulties such as inattention and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. Low conscientiousness was another attribute.
People in this group who experienced daytime impairments didn’t complain of any sleep difficulties, however. Researchers called the phenomenon “sleep resilience.”
It’s possible that people who fit this profile had sleep issues they were unaware of, Kebets said, calling it “sleep misperception.”

“Sometimes when you have some mental health issues — symptoms of anxiety or depression, for instance — maybe you’re not sleeping as well as usual, but you’re not necessarily acknowledging it because you have other stuff on your mind,” Kebets said.
No. 3: Sleep aids and sociability
The third profile represents people who took hypnotics, or sleep aids, to get a good night’s rest.
People in this group reported social satisfaction, including friendship and emotional support. They also experienced less perceived rejection and fewer attention problems.
However, this profile was also characterized by worse emotional recognition, the ability to identify others’ emotions, and visual episodic memory, the ability to vividly recall past experiences.
No. 4: Sleep duration and cognition
People who reported sleeping fewer than six to seven hours a night had lower agreeableness and higher aggressive behavior.

What’s more, people who slept little showed cognitive consequences. For example, they performed tasks involving emotional processing and fluid intelligence, which is a measure of problem-solving, with worse accuracy.
No. 5: Sleep disturbances, cognition and mental health
Sleep disturbances including pain, breathing issues, frequent urination, temperature imbalance and multiple awakenings are indicators of the fifth profile.

People in this group experienced substance abuse and poor mental health, such as thought problems and anxiety. They also demonstrated aggressive behavior and worse cognitive performance, including language processing.
Sleep critical to mind-body health

There were several major limitations to the research. Participants were overwhelmingly white, healthy, young adults who were working full time. In addition, researchers noted that “a large number of” participants were siblings, even twins.

The study also analyzed people’s sleep behavior for only a month. The five sleep profiles represent a snapshot in time, Arnedt said. “If you looked at these same people a year later, they may fall in totally different categories.”
He also noted that the study was retrospective, meaning it looked at how participants had slept in the past. Having people keep sleep diaries in real time is a preferred method of studying sleep.

However, by identifying individual sleep profiles, the findings could help sleep clinicians develop personalized treatment approaches, said Dr. Phyllis Zee, director of the Center for Circadian and Sleep Medicine at the Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine and medical director of the Northwestern Medicine Sleep Disorders Center.
“We really need to consider multiple sleep profiles in our research and clinic — the value of a multidimensional approach to data,” Zee, who wasn’t involved with the new research, said in an email.

Dr. Rafael Pelayo, a clinical professor in the division of sleep medicine at the Stanford University School of Medicine, also praised the study’s holistic approach. The five profiles, he said, may help predict who’s at risk of developing sleep problems.
It’s critical that everyone, not just health care providers, understands the multidimensional nature of sleep, said Pelayo, who wasn’t involved in the research.

“Sleep is a more complex issue than just how much time you spend in bed,” he said. “If I can improve your sleep, it has downwind effects on your overall health — not just your mental health, but your physical health.”

The new research adds to strong evidence that sleep is essential for brain and body health. Sleep disturbances, Zee said, increase the risk of problems, including mood disorders, immune issues and neurodegeneration, as in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases.

The bottom line, Pelayo said, is that the research reinforces that hope and help are available for people with sleep difficulties: “Nobody should be condemned to sleep poorly the rest of their lives.”

title: Top U.S. officials join Gaza talks as Hamas voices optimism
summary: Hamas and Egypt voiced new optimism Wednesday as President Donald Trump's envoy and key mediators joined talks to end Israel's war in Gaza.“A spirit of optimism prevails among all,” the militant group said after it submitted a list of Palestinian prisoners to be released in exchange for Israeli hostages under the U.S. plan.
story: Hamas and Egypt voiced new optimism Wednesday as President Donald Trump's envoy and key mediators joined talks to end Israel's war in Gaza.
“A spirit of optimism prevails among all,” the militant group said after it submitted a list of Palestinian prisoners to be released in exchange for Israeli hostages under the U.S. plan.
The release of those still held in Gaza and 1,950 Palestinian prisoners are crucial parts of Trump’s 20-point proposal.
Israel has not yet commented on the Hamas statement.
Egyptian President Abdel Fatah El-Sisi, who is hosting the talks in the Sharm el-Sheikh resort, said the messages he had received were also “very encouraging.”

The arrival of Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner at the third day of talks — along with Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed Abdulrahman Al Thani — comes after Israel and the Palestinians marked the second anniversary of the October 7 attacks and the devastating conflict that followed.
A high-level member of Hamas’ political branch told NBC News that Wednesday’s negotiations had begun.
A meeting on the future of Gaza would be held in Paris on Thursday, a French diplomatic source briefed on the matter told NBC News.

Representatives have been invited from the U.K., Germany, Italy, Spain, Egypt, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Jordan, Indonesia, Canada, Turkey, and the European Union High Representative for Foreign Affairs, the source said.
The source was not aware of any United States representatives who would attend.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu did not comment on the status of the talks in Egypt, but told Israelis on Tuesday that they were in “fateful days of decision.”
Trump expressed optimism about the talks, telling reporters in Washington there was “a possibility that we could have peace in the Middle East.”

Qatar wants international guarantees, led by the U.S., that what is negotiated in Egypt will lead to Israel’s withdrawal from Gaza, the entry of more aid, and a permanent end to the war, foreign ministry spokesperson Majed al-Ansari told Saudi Arabian news channel al-Hadath on Tuesday.
Wednesday "will undoubtedly be a pivotal day in determining these details," he said.

But Israel's far-right Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir urged Netanyahu to pursue "complete victory" over Hamas in Gaza, in a video posted on X that was filmed by the mosque on Jerusalem’s Temple Mount.
Another video showed him praying at the compound, his latest challenge to a decades-old understanding allowing only Muslim worship at the site.

Israel has continued its assault on Gaza while the talks have been taking place. Its military campaign has killed more than 67,000 people, reducing much of the enclave to rubble following the October 7, 2023 attacks by Hamas, in which some 1,200 people were killed and 251 taken to Gaza as hostages.

There were somber gatherings across Israel on Tuesday to mark the attacks, including in the country’s south where families and friends paid respects to the more than 370 victims killed at the Nova music festival.
Palestinians, meanwhile, reflected on two years of brutal conflict and their hopes for an end to the devastation.
Alaa Abu Daraz and her children left their home in eastern Gaza on October 7, and two years later they are yet to return, living on the streets as they seek safety.

“Our children are left in the streets, with no tent, no shelter, not even a blanket,” she told NBC News this week. “We managed through the summer and survived the heat, but the winter is unbearable; one cannot live or do anything in these conditions.”
Israel has faced mounting global isolation over its assault.

A new aid flotilla bound for Gaza that included a number of Americans was intercepted by the Israeli army Wednesday, days after the detention of activists on board a high-profile flotilla fueled international outrage.
Eight U.S. citizens were "likely abducted" by Israeli forces while on international waters, the Freedom Flotilla Coalition said Wednesday.

title: More people are using ChatGPT like a lawyer in court. Some are starting to win.
summary: With generative AI tools available to anyone with an internet connection, a rising number of litigants are using ChatGPT to assist in their legal cases.
story: Lynn White was out of options.
Behind on payments for her mobile home in Long Beach, California, and facing an eviction notice, she had no money for a lawyer. So she accepted a court-appointed attorney and lost.

But White wanted to appeal. So, she decided to consult ChatGPT. Having previously used AI to generate videos for her small music production business, she thought it might be able to help in the legal arena, too.
“It was like having God up there responding to my questions,” White said after using the chatbot and an AI-powered search engine called Perplexity to help represent herself in court.

Medicube Zero Pore Pads 2.0

“These exfoliating toner pads are an integral part of my skin care routine,” says NBC Select editorial projects manager Rebecca Rodriguez. “They’re so soothing and my skin feels clearer and smoother since I started using them.” The pads are soaked in a serum made with BHAs, AHAs and botanical extracts, ingredients that shrink pore size, improve skin texture and reduce greasiness, according to the brand. They’re also dual-sided: the textured side gently exfoliates, then the smooth side hydrates and soothes.
Amazon Smart Plug

Once you connect devices like fans, air purifiers and lamps to this smart plug, you can control them from your phone using the Amazon Alexa app, which lets you set schedules and routines, too. The plug is compact, so it won’t block your second outlet.
LifeStraw Personal Water Filter
Ed’s note: The LifeStraw Personal Water Filter is equal to its July Prime Day price from just under three months ago. Because it's a bestseller and 33% off, we still think it's a good deal.

Pack this personal water filter straw in your backpack while hiking or camping, or add it to your emergency kit. It removes over 99% of waterborne bacteria and parasites, as well as microplastics, and can clean up to 1,000 gallons of water before you need a new one, according to the brand.
Crest 3D Whitestrips Sensitive
Ed’s note: These Crest Whitestrips were a few cents lower than its current price for one day in August. Because they’re a bestseller and 44% off, we still think they’re a good deal.

Out of all the teeth whitening strips the NBC Select staff has tested, Crest’s are our no. 1 favorite because they’re easy to use, effective and earned the American Dental Association’s Seal of Acceptance. The strips are made with hydrogen peroxide (a bleaching agent) and are specifically formulated to be gentle on teeth and gums, according to the brand. You get 36 strips in this box, which is enough for 18 30-minute treatments.
Chamberlain Smart Garage Control

Chamberlain’s Smart Garage Control lets you open and close your garage door from wherever you are using the brand’s app. You can also put the door on a schedule through the app and give access to other people. The device works with most brands of garage doors made after 1993, according to Chamberlain.
Kasa Smart Light Bulbs 2-Pack

I control all the lights in my home with my phone thanks to these smart bulbs, which fit in most high hats and lamps. Through the brand’s app, you can turn the lights on and off, put them on schedules, adjust their brightness, dim them and change their color. The bulbs also respond to voice commands through voice assistants like Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant. This set comes with two bulbs.
Shark NV352 Navigator Lift Away Upright Vacuum

Clean carpets and bare floors with this corded upright vacuum, which has brushroll shutoff feature and a HEPA filter to trap dust and allergens inside. You can tote its detachable pod around your home to clean stairs, high spaces (like above door frames) and under furniture. The vacuum comes with a long crevice tool and an upholstery tool.
Fullstar Food Chopper

“This chopper’s blades are incredibly sharp, it’s easy to clean and store and it saves me so much time while cooking,” says NBC Select editorial operations associate Jem Alabi. “I can prep ingredients in bulk, freeze them and never worry about my produce going to waste. There’s even an included cleaning brush so I can scrub all the parts without risking my fingers.” The chopper comes with four interchangeable blades (two dicers, a ribbon blade and a spiral blade).
Apple AirPods 4 (with ANC)

Ed’s note: The Apple AirPods 4 are equal to their July Prime Day price (their lowest price ever) from just under three months ago. Because they’re a bestseller and 34% off, we still think they’re a good deal.

These Apple AirPods 4 have active noise cancellation to drown out sounds, but you can also use them in transparency and adaptive audio modes to hear the world around you. The sweat-, dust- and water-resistant earbuds come with a compact charging case that gives you up to 20 to 30 hours of battery life, depending on what listening mode you use. They also have Siri built-in, so you can make calls, change the song or ask questions using voice commands.
Waterpik Aquarius Water Flosser

Waterpik’s water flosser, which earned the American Dental Association’s Seal of Acceptance, comes with seven tips and has 10 pressure settings. Its tip rotates 360 degrees so you can reach all areas of your mouth, and its reservoir holds enough water for a 90-second cleaning. The water flosser pulses every 30 seconds to help you keep track of flossing time.
Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask

“It’s no secret that this lip mask is incredibly hydrating; I always wake up with super smooth lips when I use it,” says NBC Select updates editor Mili Godio. “I love the different flavors — I’ve tried most of them and they’re all delicious.” The Laneige Lip Mask, which comes with a mini applicator, is made with moisturizing, antioxidant-rich ingredients like vitamin C, coconut oil, shea butter and murumuru seed butter.
Amazon Echo Pop

Listen to music, podcasts and audiobooks through this mini Bluetooth speaker, which also has Amazon Alexa built-in. You can use voice commands to ask the virtual assistant questions, set timers and reminders, control compatible smart home devices and more. The device has volume control buttons, as well as a button to turn the microphone off.
Kiehl's Ultra Facial Cream

Ed’s note: Kiehl’s Ultra Facial Cream is equal to its July Prime Day price (its lowest price ever) from just under three months ago. Because it’s a bestseller and 30% off, we still think it’s a good deal.

“This cream is extremely hydrating, absorbs instantly and doesn’t feel heavy,” says NBC commerce senior manager of community engagement Rosalie Sparaco. “It makes my skin feel healthier and look less dull, even when I use a small amount.” The moisturizer is made with ingredients like squalane to replenish the skin barrier, plus it’s non-comedogenic and has the National Eczema Association’s Seal of Acceptance.
Orgain Organic Vegan Protein Powder

I’ve been loyal to Orgain’s protein powder for years because it checks all my boxes: gluten-free, made with plant-based ingredients, flavorful (but not in an artificial way) and filling. It also gets easily incorporated into smoothies and shakes, making them creamy rather than gritty or chalky. One serving of the powder has 21 grams of protein, and each container comes with a scooper, taking the guesswork out of measurement. You can buy Orgain’s protein powder in flavors like chocolate, vanilla, iced coffee and horchata, many of which are on sale.
Blink Video Doorbell

See, hear and speak to visitors with Blink’s Video Doorbell, which has a two-year battery life, according to the brand, and two installation options: wired or wire-free. It’s made with built-in speakers and microphones, plus a camera that gives you a head-to-toe view. The doorbell connects to the brand’s app, where you can watch livestream video and get notifications.
Ouai Detox Shampoo

I’ve been using Ouai’s Detox Shampoo once a week for over a year to deep clean my hair and scalp. It uses apple cider vinegar to exfoliate and get rid of build-up from other styling products, plus it removes chlorine, heavy metals and minerals from hard water that can cause color fading, according to the brand. The shampoo also instantly makes my hair feel softer upon application. It’s safe for all hair types, including color-treated hair, according to Ouai.
Amazon Fire TV Stick HD

Stream your favorite shows and movies in HD from any TV once you plug this Fire Stick into its HDMI port. It comes with an Amazon Alexa Remote, letting you control your TV manually or using voice commands. You can also travel with the Fire Stick to use it at hotels and rental homes.
Ecolution Micro-Pop Microwave Popcorn Popper

Make better-than-store-bought popcorn at home with this kitchen gadget. There’s a built-in measuring cup on its lid, helping you add the right amount of kernels to the 3-quart, dishwasher-safe base before putting it in the microwave. You can also put butter on top of the lid, which has holes in it; as the butter melts in the microwave, it drips onto the popcorn. The popper doubles as a serving bowl once it cools down.
JBL Go 3

Despite being small enough to fit in your pocket, this rechargeable, wireless Bluetooth speaker fills areas with sound and has up to five hours of playtime on a single charge, according to the brand. It’s water-resistant, so you can use it at the beach or pool, as well as in your bathroom. The speaker has a built-in loop, so you can use a carabiner to attach it to bags, towel racks, bikes and more.
Rubbermaid Brilliance Food Storage Containers

Meal prep and store leftovers in these dishwasher- and microwave-safe containers, each of which have a 3.2-cup capacity and come with leak-proof lids. The lids also have built-in vents so you don’t have to remove them while microwaving food. The containers come in a pack of five, and since they’re clear, you can always see what’s inside. Plus, they’re stackable, helping you save space in your kitchen.
Lego Classic Vibrant Creative Brick Box

Kids and adults alike can build anything they want using the 850 multicolored Lego pieces that come in this brick-shaped box. There’s also an included instruction booklet that guides you through constructing figures like a horse, windmill, skateboard and guitar if you need some inspiration. The Lego set is best for those 4 years old and up, according to the brand.
Keurig K-Express Single Serve Coffee Maker

This compact single-serve coffee maker won’t take up much countertop space due to its compact size. It has a strong brew mode, three cup sizes and a removable reservoir that holds enough water to make multiple beverages. The machine, which is compatible with all K-Cups, also comes with a removable drip tray so you can fit travel mugs underneath the spout.
KitchenAid Beacon Two-Tone Non-Slip Mini Oven Mitt Set

Get a new pair of oven mitts before you’re in the thick of Thanksgiving cooking or holiday baking. These machine-washable minis are made from heat-resistant cotton that protect your hand from temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit, according to the brand. There’s clear silicone grips on the mitts to help you grip pots, pans and dishes, plus a hanging loop for storage.
Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition Essentials Bundle

The Kindle Paperwhite has a 7-inch glare-free screen and a 12-week battery life, according to the brand, plus its front light automatically adjusts to whatever environment you’re in. The e-reader is also water-resistant, so you can read at the beach, pool or in the bath. This bundle includes a cover that attaches to your e-reader, waking it up or putting it to sleep as you open and close it like a book. You get a charging dock, too.
Oral-B iO Deep Clean Rechargeable Electric Powered Toothbrush

Oral-B’s rechargeable electric toothbrush has all the features dentists told me to look for in a quality toothbrush: a pressure sensor, a built-in timer, multiple cleaning settings and a brush head change alert. It comes with two replacement brush heads and a travel case.
Liquid I.V. Hydration Multiplier

Liquid I.V. is one of my favorite electrolyte powders, especially for hydrating before long runs. It comes in single-serve packets, which are convenient to throw in your bag and travel with. The powder quickly dissolves into water with a stir or shake, and each serving has 500 milligrams of sodium. You can buy Liquid I.V. in flavors like lemon lime, tropical punch and popsicle firecracker (they’re all on sale), and there’s a sugar-free version, too.
Blink Mini 2 Home Security & Pet Camera

You can use the Blink Mini 2 security camera indoors and outdoors, and it connects to the Blink app, where you can livestream HD footage, get motion detection alerts, hear audio and speak to people and pets. The camera, which is small enough to blend into my space, also has a built-in spotlight. You can use it as a plug-in chime with Blink Video Doorbells, which are also currently on sale.
Premier Protein Shake

These ready-to-drink protein shakes help keep you full on-the-go — enjoy them at home, bring them to the gym or work, or sip them in the car. Each creamy, gluten-free shake has 30 grams of protein per serving and no added sugar, according to the brand. This pack comes with 12 bottles, and various flavors are currently on sale, including chocolate, vanilla, and cafe latte.
Tide Pods Liquid Laundry Detergent

In addition to soap that cleans your clothes, these concentrated laundry detergent pods have a color protector, odor fighter and stain remover inside them. You can use them in all washing machines and they dissolve even in cold water. There’s 76 pods in a pack.
Twelve South AirFly Pro 2 Deluxe

Once you plug this dongle into the headphone jack on an airplane seat, it transmits audio to your wireless headphones via Bluetooth — that means no more panic-buying an expensive wired set at the airport. You can also plug the device into cars, exercise machines and tablets, and control the volume directly from its buttons. The AirFly Pro 2 Deluxe pairs with up to two headphones at a time, letting you share audio with another person. You get a charging cable, international airline adapter and travel bag with your purchase.
Sensodyne Extra Whitening Toothpaste

“I’ve had sensitive teeth my whole life, and anytime I switch off of Sensodyne for a little while, I always make my way back,” says Sparaco. “It makes my teeth feel better and, in a way, stronger. Plus, it leaves my mouth feeling fresh.” You get four tubes of fluoride toothpaste in this pack.
Vital Proteins Collagen Peptides Powder

Vital Proteins’ collagen powder supports hair, skin, nail, bone and joint health, plus it’s made with vitamin C to aid collagen production and hyaluronic acid to boost skin elasticity, according to the brand. You can mix it into hot and cold beverages (including coffee, water or smoothies), as well as foods like oatmeal. Each serving has 20 grams of grass-fed, pasture-raised collagen peptides. (Remember to consult your doctor before taking any supplements.)
Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask

“I have an extensive collection of face masks in my vanity, but these are the only ones I consistently re-buy,” says Rodriguez. “They feel soothing and hydrating the instant I put them on my skin, and they leave it looking glowy the next morning.” Each of Biodance’s sheet masks is soaked in a serum made with ingredients like hyaluronic acid and niacinamide to moisturize, reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, and even out complexion, according to the brand. Your skin absorbs the serum as the mask sits on your face for about three to four hours, or overnight, causing it to become transparent.
L'Occitane Cleansing & Softening Almond Shower Oil

“I wasn’t entirely convinced a shower oil would leave me feeling clean, but this one from L’Occitane is now a bathroom essential for me,” says Rodriguez. “It cleanses my skin without stripping it dry, and the scent is fresh and soothing.” You work the shower oil, which has an almond and vanilla scent, into a milky lather, and it works well to shave with or use as a bath soak, too.
AeroPress Clear Black Coffee Press

“This is the all-in-one package for a coffee lover on-the-go,” says NBC commerce video producer Josh Rios. “All you need is some water and ground coffee to make a solid 16 ounces of hot coffee in one container.” The manual brewer is a hybrid between a French press and pour-over, and it uses air pressure and a micro-filter to extract flavor from the grounds you fill it with. You can make hot, iced or espresso-style beverages with the AeroPress since you have control over brew time, temperature and grind size. It’s lightweight and compact, making it ideal for travel and gifting, says Rios.
Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch

When I use Hero Cosmetics’ pimple patches, I notice a difference in the size and irritation level of my acne, plus they prevent me from picking and popping. The hydrocolloid patches, which come in a pack of 75 (an Amazon exclusive), absorb gunk within about six hours, according to the brand. They also don’t irritate my sensitive skin.
Loop Quiet 2 Ear Plugs

Loops’ reusable ear plugs help reduce noise in loud environments, which can make sleeping, traveling and focusing easier, as well as concerts more enjoyable. They’re made from soft silicone so they feel comfortable in your ears, and you can customize their fit — they come with interchangeable ear tips in four sizes. You also get a storage case for safe keeping.
KIND Bar Minis Variety Pack

Keep these mini granola bars at home, at your office or in the car so you always have a snack nearby. Each bar has three grams of protein and is made from gluten-free, low-sugar ingredients, according to the brand. You get 30 bars in this pack, which come in three flavors: peanut butter dark chocolate, dark chocolate nuts and sea salt, and caramel almond and sea salt.

title: Demi Moore Brings Back Her Iconic '90s Bangs: 'Then and Now'
summary: Demi Moore is turning back the clock, bringing back one of her most iconic looks from the ‘90s: fringe bangs.
story: Demi Moore is turning back the clock, bringing back one of her most iconic looks from the ‘90s: fringe bangs.
In an Instagram post Oct. 8, “The Substance” actor, 62, shared two photos — from “now and then” — showing off her new hairstyle.
The first shot features Moore posing with pursed lips and her signature dark brunette hair down to her waistline, with fresh bangs somewhat parted down the middle.
“Bangs — now and then,” she wrote, thanking designer brand Gucci for “letting me bring back the fringe for the first time since the Striptease days!”
The second photo showcases the actor from her 1996 hit “Striptease,” in which she sported similar long brunette hair and bangs.
Celebrity friends, family and fans alike supported the style choice in the comments, with Keke Palmer writing, “My girl,” accompanied by a heart-eyes emoji.
Moore’s daughter Tallulah Willis, whom she shares with ex Bruce Willis, wrote, “SO GOOD too good!! We love u.”
Despite the photos being captured nearly 30 years apart, fans commented on Moore’s youthful appearance in the modern-day picture, writing, “I’ll have what she’s having.”

“I thought that was her daughter,” another commented, with others specifically comparing Moore to her daughter Scout Willis, whom she also shares with Bruce Willis. The two also share a third child, daughter Rumer Willis.
While Moore has stuck with her dark locks for some time, she has ventured out in more daring transformations over the years, including a blond pixie cut and shaving her head.

In 1990, Moore debuted a short look for “Ghost,” telling People in an April interview that she was inspired at the time by Isabella Rossellini. She recalled walking into a Parisian hair salon and showing the stylist a photo of her inspiration.
While the result caused “some serious panic and serious s--- hitting the fan,” Moore told the outlet that the film crew “really did come around.”
“(My character) was an artist, a ceramicist, and all of that, and it kind of fit,” she added. “It wasn’t an intentional thing to shock them, I think I just really needed a change.”
When asked if she would return to the pixie cut, Moore told People, “I don’t ever like to say never because you never know,” adding, “but I have grown quite attached to my hair.”
Moore's short hair then turned blond, she explained, when filming “The Butcher’s Wife,” though she ultimately wore a long, light wig for the 1991 movie.
“This was a very fun time for me to have blonde hair,” Moore told the outlet. “What I realized very quickly is that dyeing your hair blonde trashes it...But it was fun while I had it.”

Filming 1997 film “G.I. Jane,” Moore shaved her head to play a Navy SEAL in training. In a September 2024 interview with Variety, Moore said she also trained in a “two-week modified SEAL training,” adding, “It was hardcore.”

title: Tour Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott’s NYC Home, Including Her Kids’ Nature-Themed Room
summary: Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott showed off their new New York City apartment to Architectural Digest.
story: Zooey Deschanel and Jonathan Scott aren’t so much peeling back the curtain on their new home as they are opening its doors.
The “New Girl” star and her “Property Brothers” star fiancé showed off their new New York City apartment to Architectural Digest’s “Open Door.”

The highlight of the residence may be the kids’ nature-influenced bedroom, which Scott called “probably my favorite room in the whole house.” Deschanel is mother to daughter, Elsie, 10, and son, Charlie, 8, with ex-husband Jacob Pechenik.
The room has printed mural tree wallpaper that Deschanel is “obsessed with” and multiple beds with hidden drawers and railings with hand-cut leaves on them.
“When the kids saw it for the first time, they screamed,” she said.
“I do think to myself how special it feels to wake up in a space that feels creative and this exciting. And the kids just absolutely love it,” he added.

The home also features a raised ceiling Scott and Deschanel in the entrance with an arched doorway that he calls “my favorite thing,” while he noted it’s “a tease” for what follows in the rest of the abode.
Indeed, there is plenty more: a mural that Deschanel calls “magical” and “a wonderful start to this apartment we love.” Scott said it draws people in and raises the eye line.
“This place looked absolutely nothing like the way it does now when we first looked at it,” Deschanel said, while adding her first reaction seeing the place was, “Eww, gross.”
Scott said the apartment was vacant for a long time and needed “a lot of love.”
The couple redid the kitchen, which Scott called “the heart of the home,” while Deschanel credited him for his ability to maximize space.
Deschanel pointed out the lack of recessed lighting, instead choosing chandeliers, pendants, sconces and lamps, which she describes as “magical and moody and fun.”

“This is the side effect of being engaged to someone whose father is a world-class cinematographer. The lighting is very important,” Scott said, referring to her father, Academy Award-nominated cinematographer Caleb Deschanel.
The couple also showed off their living room, complete with a hidden TV screen that drops down from ceiling.
“We love a place that feels lush and pretty, but also we want our home to feel lived in and not too stark and austere,” she said.
“We love to entertain, and, frankly, you’re the first person we’ve invited over, outside of family. We haven’t had anybody here yet, so our goal is to entertain a ton,” Scott said.

The home also features a grand piano and a karaoke setup, as well as three private terraces that he says addsa little touch of Los Angeles to the apartment. In addition, there’s a family room that Deschanel calls “cozy” that has a fireplace they added, along with custom furniture.
The master bedroom features a color scheme they both chose, along with embroidered wallpaper and a mattress made by Scott Living, the furniture company he owns with his brother Drew.
“We are so collaborative,” she said.
“She has better taste than I do,” he said. “The entire vibe in this room is peaceful.”

title: Did Ed Gein Attempt to Dig Up His Own Mother? The Truth Behind 'Monster'
summary: Did Ed Gein dig up his mother August Gein? Did he attempt to? Here's what we know.
story: The new season of "Monster" focuses on Ed Gein, a 20th century killer known for his gruesome house of horrors.
Gein, who lived in a small town in Wisconsin his entire life, admitted to killing two women. He also admitted to robbing multiple graves and adorned his house with items created from body parts.
In the Netflix show, Gein — played by actor Charlie Hunnam — attempts to dig up his mother, Augusta Gein's, grave. Augusta (Laurie Metcalf) is said to have had a strong influence on her son.

"Fanatically religious," according to the Gein biography by the true crime write Harold Schecter, Augusta Gein raised her two sons in near isolation, preaching the immorality of modern women. While Ed Gein's brother Henry attempted to pull away, Ed Gein remained devoted to his mother until her death in 1945.
Did Ed Gein Dig Up His Mother's Grave?
Earl Kileen, the district attorney of Washaura County, said in a press conference in 1957 that Ed Gein had denied robbing his mother’s grave, according to the biography “Deviant” by Harold Schecter.
But according to Scott Bowser, an Ed Gein expert who gives tours in the killer's hometown of Plainfield, Wisconsin, the killer tried — and failed — to find his mother.

“He tried, on numerous occasions, to go dig her up, but she was on a cement vault and he couldn’t get to her,” Boswer tells TODAY.com. (Bowser adds, however, the series isn't entirely accurate, focusing "heavily on gore and shock value rather than truth or history.")
According to "Deviant," Kileen said the same in the press conference: "His mother's coffin was encased in a concrete vault."
Kileen also confirmed Ed Gein robbed the grave of a woman buried in a wooden box next to his parents' burial plot.

Schecter, speaking to Rolling Stone, shares the theory that Ed Gein was attempting to retrieve his mother. “The earliest bodies (he) exhumed formed a semi-circle around his mother’s grave,” Schechter said.

As for whether Augusta Gein's influence had to do with what her son became? A 1957 summary from the chief of medical services at Wisconsin's Central State Hospital concluded that Ed Gein was "overly attached to his mother."
The report said that “it seems probable that this activity was the result of his desire to re-create the existence of his own mother.”

“After the death of his mother, he felt that he had a special power whereby he could raise the dead to life by an act of his will power; and when he found that this was not successful, his emotional needs influenced him to attempt the re-creation of his mother by using the parts of bodies from other graves,” the report said.

Ed Gein also lambasted the moral standards of the two women he killed. His comments had a "strong religious connotation," per a social service report from in 1957, and he had learned "religious training from his mother."

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Father Figure’ Lyrics Reimagine George Michael’s Classic With a Sinister Twist
summary: Taylor Swift pays homage to late music legend George Michael on “Father Figure,” the fourth song on her newly released new album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”The song not only shares a title with Michael’s 1987 hit, it also borrows a melody from the original track in its chorus, thus earning the British musician a songwriting credit alongside Swift and her collaborators, Max Martin and Shellback.
story: Taylor Swift pays homage to late music legend George Michael on “Father Figure,” the fourth song on her newly released new album, “The Life of a Showgirl.”

The song not only shares a title with Michael’s 1987 hit, it also borrows a melody from the original track in its chorus, thus earning the British musician a songwriting credit alongside Swift and her collaborators, Max Martin and Shellback.
Michael’s original song is sung from the perspective of a man who wants to be a “preacher” and “teacher” — and, notably, a “daddy” — to his younger lover.
More ‘Showgirl’ Lyrics

Swift sings her version from the perspective of someone in the music industry, possibly a mentor or an executive, who is allegedly taking care of his “protégé,” demanding only “loyalty” in return.

The song has a sinister tone and contains a lyric about the “love” between this person and his protégé being “pure profit.” It also contains multiple Mafia metaphors about “protecting the family,” and features the threatening lyric, “You’ll be sleeping with the fishes,” which should sound familiar to fans of “The Godfather” film franchise.
On “The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon,” Swift explained that a TV show partially inspired this song.

“I kept thinking about that scene in ‘Succession’ where Logan looks at his kids and says, ‘I love you but you are not serious people.’ I think about that scene constantly,” she said. “I think it’s one of the coolest scenes ever. I was like I want to write a song that has that energy, of Logan Roy being like, ‘You bit the hand that fed you and you do not possess the vernacular to be doing this.’”
Also, for a song themed around power dynamics — it turns out that Taylor Swift and George Michael have some similarities when it comes to their power struggles in the music industry.

Swift famously re-recorded and re-released her several of her albums as “Taylor’s Versions” after losing the rights to her master recordings when businessman Scooter Braun bought her former record label Big Machine Records and then sold her masters. She announced in May that she had bought all of her master recordings.

Like Swift, Michael also battled his record company, Sony Music, unsuccessfully suing the company in 1992 over his contract and claiming the company regarded him as “no more than a piece of software,” according to the BBC.

During an appearance on BBC1, Swift also spoke about the connection (or lack thereof) between her song “Father Figure” and the 2024 movie “Babygirl” starring Nicole Kidman and Harris Dickinson, which features “Father Figure” prominently.

“It was actually written before then,” Swift said of her song. “I thought it was a fun coincidence. It’s a very different way of using a father figure to talk about power and power structures and the flipping of the power dynamics.”

title: 'Dancing With the Stars' Announces a Live Tour: How to Get Tickets
summary: "Dancing With the Stars" announced its pro dancers will be hitting the road next year for its 2026 live tour. Find tour dates for your city and learn how to get tickets.
story: "Dancing With the Stars" is bringing the ballroom to a city near you.

The dance competition show announced its pro dancers will be hitting the road next year for the "Dancing With the Stars Live" tour, beginning in January in Akron, Ohio, and wrapping up in May in Salt Lake City.

Pro dancers like Emma Slater, Val Chmerkovskiy, Britt Stewart, Ala Bernsten, Brandon Armstrong, Jenna Johnson, Daniella Karagach, Pasha Pashkov, Ezra Sosa and Hailey Bills are set to perform on the tour, according to the tour's website.
The tour announcement was made during the Oct. 7 episode, where the stars and pro dancers performed to songs from Disney classics in honor of the night’s theme, Disney Night.
Hilaria Baldwin and her partner Gleb Savchenko were eliminated at the end of the episode, and Baldwin thanked her family for their support while she was on the show.
“This has been an incredible experience,” Baldwin said. “I’m so grateful to all of you.”

Tickets for the "Dancing With the Stars" tour go on sale on Friday, Oct. 10 at 10 a.m. Fans who signed up for the Mirrorball Membership also had access to a presale tickets at 10 a.m. on Wednesday, Oct. 8.
Keep reading for a full list of tour dates.

title: What Time Is Taylor Swift on 'Late Night with Seth Meyers'? How to Tune In
summary: Taylor Swift is set to appear on 'Late Night With Seth Meyers' to discuss 'The Life of a Showgirl.' Here's when to watch and how to stream the interview.
story: Taylor Swift is continuing her "Life of a Showgirl" press tour.
The "Fate of Ophelia" singer will appear on "Late Night with Seth Meyers" tonight to talk about her new album causing chatter in the Swiftie universe and beyond.
The pop star has appeared on a number of TV shows and radio stations since she released "Life of a Showgirl" on Oct. 3.
She recently visited "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" on its Oct. 6 episode to promote her new album, noting how happy she was that the album is finally out.

"This has just been, I think the most well-matched era in terms of where my life was when I wrote it and where I am now when it's out in the world," she told host Jimmy Fallon. "I feel the exact same way as I did when I wrote and recorded these songs."
The "Midnights" singer is expected to drop more gems about "Life of a Showgirl" during her appearance on "Late Night with Seth Meyers."
Scroll below to see how you can watch her upcoming appearance on the NBC late-night talk show.
What time will Taylor Swift be on 'Late Night with Seth Meyers'?
Swift’s episode of “Late Night with Seth Meyers” will air at 12:35 a.m. ET on Oct. 9.
How to watch Taylor Swift on ‘Late Night with Seth Meyers’
"Late Night with Seth Meyers" will air live on NBC, and the show will also be available to stream the next day on Peacock.
(NBC and Peacock are owned by TODAY.com’s parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: Watch Bad Bunny Get Foul Ball at Yankees Game
summary: Bad Bunny nabbed a foul ball during Game 3 of the New York Yankees-Toronto Blue Jays ALDS playoff game at Yankee Stadium.
story: Bad Bunny has become Mr. October.

A two-week stretch in which he was announced as this season's Super Bowl halftime performer and hosted the Season 51 premiere of "Saturday Night Live" had another highlight moment on Oct. 7 when he nabbed a foul ball at Yankee Stadium during the New York Yankees' playoff game against the visiting Toronto Blue Jays.

The international superstar was sitting two rows behind home plate during the Yankees' eventual 9-6 comeback win over the Blue Jays in the American League Division Series when he grabbed a souvenir after it nearly plunked him in the head.

Toronto outfielder Anthony Santander popped up a foul ball straight behind home plate in the third inning. Video shared by Major League Baseball showed Bad Bunny initially covering his head to avoid the ball bonking him on the skull before recovering to pick up the loose baseball.
He then held it up for the cameras with a smile as fans enjoyed the moment.
"Even the baseballs wanna collab with him now," one fan joked on X.
"Is he just everywhere?" another wrote.
The Yankees are hoping that it's good luck, as the victory kept their season alive for another game. They trail the Blue Jays 2-1 in the best-of-five series.

The Puerto Rican superstar wasn't the only memorable fan to catch a baseball in the stands at a playoff game on Oct. 7. A Seattle Mariners fan wearing a shirt that said "Dump 61 Here"  serendipitously came up with a home run ball in Seattle's playoff win over the Detroit Tigers.

The shirt was referring to the nickname "Big Dumper" for Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, who hit a team-record 60 home runs in the regular season. Raleigh hit his 61st home run overall and first of the playoffs into the bullpen in left field at Detroit's Comerica Park, and it bounced right to fan Jameson Turner in his custom shirt.
Turner then took off his shirt to reveal an updated shirt that said "Dump 62 Here."

Raleigh didn't deposit No. 62 into the seats in the game, but he did help the Mariners take a 2-1 lead in the best-of-five series. The Mariners-Tigers winner will face the winner of the Yankees-Blue Jays series in the American League Championship Series.

title: 'Love Is Blind' Star Addresses Backlash to Conversation About LGBTQ+ Kids
summary: "Love Is Blind" star Nick Amato responded to backlash about his comments to LGBTQ+ kids.
story: "Love Is Blind" viewers had a lot to say about Nick Amato and Annie Lancaster's conversation about LGBTQ+ children.
The two singles, who later went on to get engaged, discussed the topic of parenting a child who belongs to the LGBTQ+ community in Episode 4 of Season 9 of the dating show.
Now, Nick is responding to viewers who weren't pleased with how the conversation went. Below, we're outlining everything you need to know about the controversy and his response.
What Did Nick and Annie Say in the Dating Pods?
While getting to know each other in the "Love Is Blind" pods, Nick and Annie started talking about their desire to have children one day.
Nick then posed the following question to Annie: "How would you react if at some point your child told you they were LGBTQ+?"
"No matter what, I'm always going to love my kids. But I can't tell you I would be the first person to be like, 'Yay!' You know what I mean?" Annie responded.
"I do know exactly what you mean," Nick said.

Annie went on to explain her response, saying, "I'll support my kids, but (would be) making sure that they're informed. Like, 'Do you know what you're doing? Do you know what you're getting into? Do you know what you're signing up for?" she said.
Nick then asked Annie if she thinks certain subsets of the LGBTQ+ community are "a fad."
"100%," she said.
Nick then explained why he would be concerned if his child's friend suggested they might be a member of the LGBTQ+ community.
"When kids start having those thoughts too young — and maybe I am old fashioned — but it's like a concern for me because who's telling you that?" he said.

Nick went on to recall a time in high school where he was "depressed." Concerned about his well-being, his mother was curious if something bigger was going on and asked if her son was gay. He said no.
The conversation elicited a strong response from viewers.

"Nick and Annie’s conversation about potential children identifying as LGBTQIA is sickening beyond belief and a tragic reminder of what our youth are facing. People deserve more than this," one X user commented.

Another penned the following reaction: "Watching love is blind and genuinely shocked that netflix included the conversation between Annie and Nick talking about if they would be okay having lgbtq+ kids."
One social media user also commented, "I’ll be fast forwarding through all of Annie and Nick scenes after that gross homophobic conversation."
What Did Nick Say About the Backlash?
Nick took to Instagram to share a response to viewer backlash. In a video message, Nick said the "gay kids and gay love conversation" had been "deeply impacting me over the last couple of days."
“I appreciate you giving me all the hell that you did and saying, ‘That’s not right.’ Yes, it was cut up and edited, but I need to take accountability too,” he said.
Nick admitted "there's a lot that I didn't understand."

The Season 9 star also clarified the use of the term "fad" in his conversation with Annie, saying they were referring to "over-introducing sexual content material to kids' shows at a young age or the idea of gay identity."
Nick said he would "love my kids regardless" of their sexual identity and brought up the example of his mother questioning him if he was gay in high school.

"I laughed it off and you know, I said, 'Oh no, there's no way!' But why would I have had to defend myself for that? You know, it doesn't make any sense because being gay is perfectly normal but I wasn't normalized to that," he said.
Nick ended his video by saying he wanted to use his platform to inform others and not spread hate.

“There’s so much hate in this world. If I can’t use this platform to help introduce people who used to think like I did to some of these new ideas ... if I can’t use that platform for good then it’s a platform wasted.”

In the caption, he wrote, "I take full accountability for how my words came across but I am glad it provoked this discussion and my learning. I was born in a traditional Midwestern environment, and I now recognize how that shaped certain blind spots (I’m thankful for the support of my friends recently for helping me learn this)."

title: Dolly Parton's Sister Freida Clarifies Comments on Country Singer's Health: 'I Didn't Mean to Scare Anyone'
summary: Dolly Parton's sister Freida Parton has clarified her comments after she asked for prayers regarding the country star's health.
story: Dolly Parton's sister has clarified her comments after she asked for prayers regarding the country star's health.
Freida Parton, a younger sister of the singer, said she wanted to "clear something up" in a Facebook post on Oct. 7.

"I didn’t mean to scare anyone or make it sound so serious when asking for prayers for Dolly," she said. "She’s been a little under the weather, and I simply asked for prayers because I believe so strongly in the power of prayer. It was nothing more than a little sister asking for prayers for her big sister."
She thanked her followers for lifting her sister up, adding, "Your love truly makes a difference."
Representatives for Dolly Parton did not immediately respond to a request for comment from NBC News.
Freida Parton's comments come less than 12 hours after she asked her followers in a separate Facebook post to pray for her older sister because she said Dolly Parton wasn't feeling well.

"Last night, I was up all night praying for my sister, Dolly. Many of you know she hasn’t been feeling her best lately. I truly believe in the power of prayer, and I have been lead to ask all of the world that loves her to be prayer warriors and pray with me," she wrote.
"She’s strong, she’s loved, and with all the prayers being lifted for her, I know in my heart she’s going to be just fine," she continued. "Godspeed, my sissy Dolly. We all love you!"
Last month, Dolly Parton announced she would be postponing her upcoming performances in Las Vegas due to "health challenges."
The country icon said in a Sept. 28 statement posted on Instagram her doctors told her she would need to have "a few procedures," without specifying what kind.

“As I joked with them, it must be time for my 100,000-mile check-up, although it’s not the usual trip to see my plastic surgeon!” she wrote. "In all seriousness, given this, I am not going to be able to rehearse and put together the show that I want you to see, and the show that you deserve to see. You pay good money to see me perform, and I want to be at my best for you."
Dolly Parton added she will be able to work on the rest of her projects from her home in Nashville, Tennessee, and that she just needs more time to "get show ready."

"And don't worry about me quittin' the business because God hasn't said anything about stopping yet," she said. "But, I believe He is telling me to slow down right now so I can be ready for more big adventures with all of you."
She thanked her followers for understanding and said she loved them. Her performances in Las Vegas were originally scheduled for December and have been rescheduled for September 2026.

title: 'Wicked: For Good' Tickets Are Now on Sale. Here's How to Get Them
summary: 'Wicked: For Good' tickets go on sale online today following the new trailer reveal. Learn how to purchase your tickets and secure your seats for the film.
story: "Wicked: For Good" tickets are finally on sale!
The news was announced on Oct. 8 in a trailer on the film's official social media accounts.

The clip teased moments from the upcoming movie including what appeared to be Glinda's wedding and her reunion with Elphaba. There is also a moment in the trailer where Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo sing a snippet of “For Good.”
"Get tickets now. Witness the epic conclusion," the words displayed on clip read.

To celebrate the tickets being on sale, Universal Pictures will be releasing an all-new piece that highlights some songs that will be in the film. The piece also offers a first listen for two new songs — "Girl in the Bubble" and "No Place Like Home" — which will be in the film.

Tickets are now available for all types of screenings, including  Amazon Prime member early screenings on Nov. 17, early access screenings in premium formats on Nov. 19 and double features on Nov. 20.

"Wicked: For Good" is based on the popular Broadway musical, which follows the success of 2024’s “Wicked.” On Sept. 24, Universal Pictures released the final trailer “Wicked: For Good," which showed some exciting moments from the forthcoming film.

In the final trailer, Elphaba was seen flying in the air and carving out the words, “Our wizard lies,” in the clouds, as Glinda watched from below. There was also a never-before-seen moment where Elphaba confronted Glinda and told her she has “no real power.”
Thanks to her role as Elphaba, Erivo earned an Academy Award nomination earlier this year for best actress in a leading role, and Grande got nominated for best supporting actress.
“Wicked: For Good” is expected to hit theaters on Nov. 21.

title: 'DWTS' Contestant Says They're 'Cheering on Everybody' After Disney Night Elimination
summary: Who went home on "Dancing With the Stars"? Here's who was eliminated after Disney Night during the Oct. 7 episode.
story: The latest episode of “Dancing With the Stars” celebrated the happiest place on Earth.

Disney Night took over the Oct. 7 episode of “DWTS,” kicking off with an opening number set to “Be Our Guest” from “Beauty and the Beast” and choreographed by Mandy Moore. It also included an appearance from Danny Gardner, who plays Lumière in the film’s North American tour.

Co-hosts Alfonso Ribeiro and Julianne Hough then introduced the 11 remaining couples — all decked out in their Disney-themed attire ready to get people's votes. Disney icons like Mickey and Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Daisy and Pluto were also in the ballroom.
Last week, viewers were left shocked after the elimination of Fifth Harmony singer Lauren Jauregui and partner Brandon Armstrong. Unfortunately, one more couple will take their final bow this season.
Here’s a recap of what went down on the “DWTS” fourth episode, including the dances, scores from judges Carrie Ann Inaba, Bruno Tonioli and Derek Hough, and who was eliminated.
What Did Each Star Dance to and What Was Their Score?

title: 'The Voice' Season 28 Singers Are Set. See Who is Team Snoop, Niall, Reba and Bublé

story: Every “The Voice” Season 28 coach has proudly declared “My team is full,” which means the Blind Auditions stage is officially over!

title: EXCLUSIVE: Is Mayci Neeley on Team Whitney Leavitt or Jen Affleck on 'DWTS'? She Reveals Who Gets Her Vote
summary: “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Mayci Neeley shares who she’s voting for between Whitney Leavitt and Jen Affleck on “Dancing With the Stars.”
story: This season of “Dancing With the Stars” sees two stars from “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” competing for the Mirrorball.

Jen Affleck and Whitney Leavitt from the Hulu reality show have been showing off their dance moves during the show’s 34th season. Both have impressed the judges over the last three weeks,  with Leavitt and her partner, Mark Ballas, leading the pack with the highest scores.
So when asked which of her co-stars she’s voting for, “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” Mayci Neeley tells TODAY.com that it’s one of the most popular questions she’s been asked recently.
“Everyone’s asking how I’m voting. I said 50/50 and that’s... all they’re gonna get,” Neeley says.
She added, “If you had to choose, I’m like, I’m telling you right now, I’d still do 50/50 because I love both of them. I want them to both succeed.”
Neeley says that she’s become a “full-fledged fan” of “DWTS” now that her friends are on the show.
“Oh my gosh, I love it. I haven’t watched it since I was in high school,” she says. “My mom used to turn it on every week and she loves it.”
Before, Neeley says she would only watch the show’s highlights on TikTok.
“But now, since the girls are on it, I’m definitely watching. (I'm a) full-fledged fan now and I got to go to opening night, which was so fun," she continues.
Neeley jokes that if she were to be a contestant on “DWTS,” “I’d be the absolute worst.”
“But seeing Whitney and Jen do it, they love it. They’re so passionate about it,” she added. “It’s so overwhelming. I feel like I was getting emotional watching.”
Both Leavitt and Affleck are still going strong and will continue to impress the judges and viewers during the Oct. 7 Disney Night episode.

title: Will 'Monster' Ever Focus on Ted Bundy? What Co-Creator Ian Brennan Says
summary: The latest season of “Monster” tells the story of Ed Gein, a Wisconsin man who killed at least one person and dug up bodies from a cemetery.
story: The latest season of “Monster” tells the story of Ed Gein, a Wisconsin man who killed at least one person and dug up bodies from a cemetery. But there are some killers so vile, the creators of the show say they won’t make a season about them.

Ian Brennan, one of the creators of Netflix’s “Monster” series, told TODAY.com during the “Monster: The Ed Gein Story” red carpet premiere that murderers like Ted Bundy will never get the “Monster” treatment.

“Ted Bundy is just a monster. It’s just about sadism and sexual violence. We just don’t find that interesting,” Brennan says. “It’s like, not only is that hard to watch, that’s like hard to write. Like, I just don’t, there’s not a mind there that you want to get inside, or even to get inside.”

“There’s a deep banality to most evil, really, and that’s why someone like Ed (Gein) is so interesting,” he added. “I hesitate to even call him evil, that’s like the wrong vocabulary to even describe him. He was just so deeply strange.”
Brennan said he and Ryan Murphy, the co-creator of “Monster,” try to find stories that are multi-dimensional for the series.

“Rather than recoil, you just sort of want to lean in,” Brennan said. “And whenever we get to a place where we’re leaning in on something, even as as macabre and dark and strange and upsetting as the Ed Gein story, you know you’re on to something.”
Brennan described Gein as "a very, very fascinating person" who "contains multitudes."

"A big part of this series is starting seasons and abandoning them, because you never know quite know what's gonna feel right. Sometimes we start writing and it's like, 'Eugh,' particularly when you're dealing with murder," he said. "Most murders, most murderers are not interesting. They're just tragic and awful and violent and sadistic. So it takes like, an interesting curveball that can sort of get past all those criticisms internally and be something you want to spend eight hours with."
Brennan previously said in an interview with Variety published on Sept. 30 that serial killers like the Golden State Killer and John Wayne Gacy have "nothing redemptive" in their stories.
“The second the name comes up for us, every year, both of us go, No. There’s no pathos,” Brennan said of Gacy.
As for Bundy, Murphy told Variety: “When you look at those crimes, what are the themes there? It doesn’t ask you any questions about society. It feels too murderous — not interesting enough.”

While there may never be a full season about Bundy, the serial killer does make an appearance in "Monster: The Ed Gein Story." Here's what to know about the fictional connection between Ed Gein and Ted Bundy.
Did Ed Gein Help Find Ted Bundy?

In the last episode of "Monster: The Ed Gein Story," Gein, played by Charlie Hunnam, appears to help authorities find Bundy, though it also could be a figment of his own imagination as he thinks through the killers he could have influenced after he inspired movies like "Psycho."
In real life, Gein had no connection to Bundy's arrest.
Gein was arrested in 1957 after investigators found the body of Bernice Worden, a local hardware store owner, hanging by the heels on his property, according to the Associated Press.
When investigators went inside Gein's home, they found a house of horrors, including severed body parts, furniture made of human skin and more, according to the AP.

After his arrest, Gein admitted to killing two people and digging up the graves of several women in interviews with investigators, according to a transcript of the interviews included in the book, “The Ed Gein File” compiled by John Borowski.

Gein was sent to a psychiatric hospital after his arrest, and in 1968, a judge found him guilty of murder, though the same judge later ruled Gein was insane at the time of the crime and sent him back to the facility, according to the Associated Press.

In 1978, Gein was transferred to the Mendota Mental Health Institute, where he would remain until his death in 1984, meaning he was in the hospital when Bundy committed his crimes and was unable to help authorities with Bundy's arrest.
Bundy was convicted of killing three people, though he confessed to killing more than two dozen women and girls, and he's suspected in the murderers of even more, according to the FBI.

A Pensacola, Florida, police officer initiated a traffic stop on Feb. 15, 1978, after he noticed an orange Volkswagen Beetle was stolen, according to the FBI. Bundy, inside the car, resisted arrest but was eventually taken into custody.
The officer didn't know who Bundy was, but he was later identified, as he had been added to the FBI's Ten Most Wanted Fugitives list on Feb. 10, 1978, according to the FBI.
After Bundy was convicted, he was sentenced to death and was executed by electric chair on Jan. 24, 1989.

title: Sara Bareilles Is Married! Meet Her Husband, Joe Tippett
summary: Sara Bareilles and Joe Tippett have been together since 2017. Learn about the actor's career, how the couple met, and their relationship timeline.
story: Sara Bareilles' husband, Joe Tippett, is a multi-hyphenate.
Not only does he play guitar, but he's also starred in many Broadway productions, including "Waitress," where he met Bareilles in 2015. Bareilles wrote the music and lyrics for "Waitress" as well.
The two started dating and then got engaged in 2023. Bareilles shared the happy news on Instagram when she shared a photo of her looking lovingly into Tippett's eyes.

"Yes to marrying this man. It’s an easy, earned, relaxed YES. @joetipps you are exactly who I want. The more I know you the more I know I love you … and you have introduced me to parts of myself I was afraid to love," she wrote on the platform. "And now I love ME more because of you. So really this is all about me. Just kidding. What a gift you are. Let the games begin. Onward into absolutely everything with you."
Bareilles and Tippett tied the knot in early October. The couple posted pictures on Instagram of their wedding day.
"We did a big thing. I will just say I love this man and I love the community who came to hold us up. I am feeling so lucky and so grateful," Bareilles shared online.
Scroll below to learn more about Sara Bareilles’ husband, Joe Tippett.
He's an actor
Tippett has had roles across film and TV. He's known for playing John Ross in "Mare of Easttown," Hal Jackson in "The Morning Show" and Tim in "Monarch Legacy of Monsters."
He's also working on a new movie called "Happy Hours." According to IMDb, the film is about a pair of former sweethearts who rekindle their connection years later after they broke up.
He's a college dropout
Tippett spoke about his life in a 2015 interview with Broadway.com. There, he revealed he dropped out of college because his drinking was getting in the way.

“I got a full tuition scholarship to West Virginia University. It’s like the Juilliard of Appalachia. I started taking acting seriously. Then I dropped out of college because I was also taking drinking very seriously. My BAC was higher than my GPA," he said.
His brother got him into theater
While speaking with Broadway.com, Tippett revealed his brother was the one who got him into theater.

“My brother got me into theater when they were shorthanded for the school production of 'Bye Bye Birdie,'" he said. "I was just picking up girls — lifting them, not hitting on them. Well, maybe a little of both.”
He proposed to Sara Bareilles with a 'cheap' ring
Tippett recalled how he proposed to Bareilles in an interview with People. He said he asked her to be his wife when they were on a trip to Mexico City and had been talking about married life.

“We kind of connected and got things back on track. We had been looking for the perfect ring and couldn’t find it. And I was like, ‘I just want to do it!’ So we found this cheap little ring in a market that we both love, and we were like, ‘That’s the thing for now!’" he said.
